Micro-Manage is Micro-Damage to the Culture. Dynamic and Agile leader should never Micro-manage.Recent article in TOI suggests the same Not micro-managing your team can bring several advantages:1. Employee Empowerment: By avoiding micro-management, you allow your team members to take ownership of their work and make decisions. This promotes a sense of empowerment, boosts their confidence, and encourages creativity and innovation.2. Improved Productivity: When employees have autonomy and the freedom to work in their own style, they can utilize their skills and expertise more effectively. This often leads to increased productivity as they can focus on their work without unnecessary interruptions or rigid controls.3. Enhanced Morale and Engagement: Trusting your team to handle their tasks without constant supervision fosters a positive work environment. It shows that you value their abilities and trust them to deliver results. This can improve employee morale, job satisfaction, and overall engagement.4. Professional Growth: Micromanagement can stifle professional growth as it limits employees' opportunities to learn and develop new skills. Allowing individuals to take on challenges, make mistakes, and learn from them promotes continuous learning and personal growth within the team.5. Time Management: By refraining from excessive monitoring, you can allocate your time more effectively. Rather than focusing on minute details, you can concentrate on strategic planning, building relationships, and addressing larger organizational goals.6. Collaboration and Teamwork: A non-micromanaging approach encourages collaboration and teamwork. When employees have the freedom to communicate, share ideas, and contribute to the decision-making process, it strengthens the overall dynamics of the team and promotes a culture of collaboration.7. Retention and Recruitment: A supportive work environment with less micro-management tends to attract and retain talented employees. Professionals seek autonomy, trust, and opportunities for growth. By offering these qualities, you can build a strong team and reduce turnover.Remember, effective leadership involves providing guidance, setting clear expectations, and being available for support when needed, while still giving your team the autonomy they need to thrive.

Mind your Mind â€œDonâ€™t let others ruin your happinessâ€, one of my friends told me while referring to the constant politics at the office. Most of the times political correctness is important to succeed than mere performance. Thatâ€™s a fact. At times we take the office scene way too seriously. The value of earning a livelihood most of the times is overestimated. Probably, itâ€™s the attachment to our posts and positions which doesnâ€™t allow us to see ourselves out of the office setting.I too like many other professionals struggle with this challenge. The only good thing is I have started to notice it more often than before. I canâ€™t stop the mind from thinking but what definitely I can control is the focus of my thinking ğŸ§ The epic text Bhagavad Gita explains à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤®à¤¨à¤¾ à¤­à¤µ à¤®à¤¦à¥à¤­â€à¤•à¥à¤¤à¥‹ à¤®à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤œà¥€ à¤®à¤¾à¤‚ à¤¨à¤®à¤¸à¥à¤•à¥à¤°à¥ à¥¤à¤®à¤¾à¤®à¥‡à¤µà¥ˆà¤·à¥à¤¯à¤¸à¤¿ à¤¯à¥à¤•à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥ˆà¤µà¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤‚ à¤®à¤¤à¥à¤ªà¤°à¤¾à¤¯à¤£: à¥¥ Engage your mind always in thinking of Me, become My devotee, offer obeisances to Me and worship Me. Being completely absorbed in Me, surely you will come to Me.(9.34)So the key is the â€˜engagement/focus of the mindâ€™. By shifting our focus we will able to free our mind and ourselves from the artificial shackles which is binding us. When you change your focus your goals and attachments automatically change. Hereâ€™s what can help us from coming out of that vicious circle â­•ï¸ 1. Mantra Meditation relaxes the mind like anything. Itâ€™s kind of reset the whole system. Do it for 10 mins to begin with everyday ğŸ§˜â€â™‚ï¸ 2. Make a list of 10 things which your profession canâ€™t provide you. You will be shocked to see the list has the most important things of our life. 3. Improve your engagement level at places other than office - home, social centre, gym, temple etc. Open up more avenues for your mind. 4. Last but not the least - READ BOOKS regularly. It stimulates the deep inherent power of the mind like anything. Donâ€™t stop thinking ğŸ¤” or try to become thoughtless you canâ€™t do that, just shift the focus of your thoughts. #corporatemythology #mindfulness #leadershipsutras

Life after the layoff: DAY 52What was your shortest job tenure?For me, it was job number six.With the telemarketing chapter of my life complete, I was enjoying the life of a job-free high school senior. That was until my science teacher, Mr. Voigts, recommended me to Harlan, the owner of the local grain elevator at the north end of town. I went there and got the details from Harlan: work from after school until supper during the week, plus Saturdays. The wage was $7.25/hour, more than I earned in most other jobs before and after that for a while. I agreed, and started the next day.Farmers sell their corn and soybeans at a grain elevator at harvest time. You may have seen an elevator in a small town, with their shiny steel bins. Tractors pull up to them with their wagons and unload the grain â€“ this was where I helped out most of the time. The remaining time was just for odd jobs around the place, doing things that OSHA would probably frown upon, especially for a 17 year-old. Lots of finger-hungry machines and copious amounts of grain dust. The most harrowing thing was being asked to climb the metal ladder up the 70-foot-tall elevator leg to grease it. Still makes my palms sweat.The money was coming in and burning a hole in my pocket. I remember heading to Co-Op Records in the college town 45 minutes away to spend part of my first paycheck on a Pearl Jam live bootleg CD that cost $29.99. I was making bootleg-CD-level wages. Sweet!Harlan requested that I get the tractor from the shed and pull it around to hook up to another piece of equipment. This tractor had a loader on the front, making it stick out much more than I was used to. When I backed out, I turned too soon and peeled back about 18" of trim from the shed door. A silly mistake, but nothing that a hammer and three nails couldn't remedy.I received a somewhat stern warning to avoid hitting anything else on the property with the loader, especially the expensive blowers attached to the steel bins. I went about the rest of the shift feeling sheepish, but not concerned. At shift's end, I went inside to ask if I was needed the next day. This was normal, as it was always going to be a short-term gig during the peak of the harvest season. Every day so far, I was asked to return. Not this day."Do you need me to come in tomorrow, Harlan?" I asked."Nope, I think we're good," he said."How about the rest of the week?" I inquired, pretty much already knowing the answer."Nope."There you have it. Not dismissed, but not asked to return the next day, either. Those two and a half weeks of labor would be my last in the agricultural realm. I wasn't ready for content work yet, but I was one step closer.â¦ Let me know if you are looking for a UX/Content Design Leader, as I'm #opentowork! #layoffs #uxwriter #contentdesign #productdesign #UXdesign #contentstrategy â¦

Indeed, pencil art can be incredibly beautiful.The fine lines, delicate shading, and intricate details created through pencil drawings can evoke a sense of elegance, realism, and artistic expression.Pencil art has a unique charm that captures the essence of the subject matter and showcases the skill and creativity of the artist.The monochromatic nature of pencil drawings allows for a focus on form, texture, and contrast, which can result in visually stunning artwork.Whether it's a portrait capturing the emotions and nuances of a person's face, a still life drawing with intricate details and textures of objects, or a landscape conveying a sense of depth and atmosphere, pencil art has the ability to captivate viewers and evoke an emotional response.Moreover, pencil art offers a timeless quality. The black and white tones and the classic look of pencil drawings can transcend trends and fads, allowing them to maintain their beauty and relevance over time.Whether it's the realism, the expressive lines, or the artistic interpretation, pencil art indeed possesses a unique beauty that continues to captivate and inspire both artists and art enthusiasts alike.FollowÂ Harshit SrivastavaÂ for more such creative content!#artÂ #artistÂ #creativityÂ #pencildrawingÂ #artwork

I got a job. After 40 interviews and what has to be hundreds and hundreds of applications, it finally worked out.Here are 9 things I learned during my job search after my layoff:1. Ensure your resume is compatible w/ applicant tracking systems. I had no idea this was a thing until I worked specifically with a resume writer, but given the sheer volume of applicants, having a resume that is automatically parsable by internal systems makes a difference.2. Daily goals. Setting daily goals helped me maintain a balance and create a routine as I was applying. For me personally, these included applying to at least 5 jobs daily, not turning on the TV until after 5pm, and spending at least an hour a day reading or learning something new. This helped create structure during an unpredictable period.3. Apply daily and filter on the last 24 hrs. Given the market, some jobs I applied for had 300+ applicants. To combat this, on a day to day basis, filter your search to jobs posted in the last 24 hrs. By doing so, I was usually within the first few to apply for a job, which helped get my foot in the door. Baking this into your daily routine makes it a lot less overwhelming to apply for positions, as there are fewer postings you need to scroll through every day.4. Nationwide vs city filters for remote jobs. If you are open to remote work, have separate alerts for your overall country as well as your individual city. A lot of remote jobs donâ€™t show up in city specific listings.5. Flexible title searching. Position titles change across companies, so donâ€™t just limit it to a single title search. Have a job search going for the specific title you are aiming for, but also have an alert that filters a more generic title e.g. â€œProduct Managerâ€, with additional filtering on experience level. 6. Responses come in waves. There will be weeks where you won't hear anything, and a week will come up where you hear from multiple places all at once. Remain patient, and know that responses and interview requests will come in batches.7. Compensation. Ask for the compensation range during your first call. Interview processes are extremely lengthy and time consuming, make sure that at the end of the line if you were to receive an offer, it would match your expectations.8. Culture & fit. While weâ€™re the ones applying for a job, its important to make sure that the company is a good fit for us as well. We spend so much of our time at work, so it's important to ask and assess things such as work culture, team dynamic, and manager personality and philosophy.9. Take time to relax. This is the most important. It's ok to do nothing for a bit. It's ok to take time out of your day and do something that brings you joy. It's ok to not have everything you do on a day to day basis be related to finding a job or bettering yourself.Â Extended time away from work, no matter the circumstances, doesn't come around often - use it well.#jobsearch #layoffs #jobhunt #hiring #jobhelp

People confuse non-attachment with some renunciation & withdrawal from Life! The image conjured up is one where people head off to some caves donning saffron robes, chanting with beads in hand & ashes smeared on the forehead! It is anything but... Instead, it's a process where we come to terms with the Reality of Impermanence & seek to cling less tightly to everything! We try to figure out a path where we remain connected yet aware of the limitations of the system! When you no longer seek to find yourself in something, the detachment drops off in what seems natural as opposed to the struggle to let go!For me, this is better preparedness for the unexpected! When one is less set on a specific outcome, then you are in a much better place in handling whatever the outcome is! The ones who give up trying to control the uncontrollables have an edge as they are not fighting battles that cannot be won & can spend their time and energy on the movable parts! They have an Acceptance & a Surrender mindset and are able to handle and cope with Life's surprises! ğŸ—ï¸ By having less attachment, one is able to go with the flow! ğŸ—ï¸ It means that however things unravel, I will be OK! ğŸ—ï¸ My being OK is not attached to some specific outcomes beyond my control! Ask yourself, what am I so attached to that causes me on-going suffering & see if you can do the work to release it!!! If we do not learn how to connect the dots properly, we suffer from disconnect & that disconnect does not serve us... Saffron robes, bead collection & ashes - All optional ğŸ˜ğŸ˜ğŸ˜To be notified of my Daily Post - I invite you to "Ring my Bell" by clicking on the ğŸ”” icon!  #wisdomwednesday #whatinspiresme #energy #mindset #detachment

As the Menace of Layoffs is continuing and we are hearing about so many of our friends and peers loosing their jobs. I am of the opinion that more than the layoffs, it is untimely and unexpected ask by the organisation to leave when we are completely dependent on it without any backup or preparedness. Unfortunately in the last one week, I have received so many calls from the known and unknown sharing the bitter truth of them getting laid-off, looking for opportunities or an ideal to-do list to find a job. I am a firm believer that continuous efforts and constant learning in our careers will help us in the long term to become resilient.In the light of these developments, I would like to jot down few steps that have helped me and few of my other friends for a career transition or finding an ideal job or a new job search :1) Planning your career and Priorities well in advance : It is always important to have a long term plan of your career, understanding your top priorities in choosing a career and having a mental plan of how you look at your career for a decade or more will help in showing you way forward and taking the right next step in the direction2) CV That reflects and Speaks for you : CV is the first key to the door of opportunities. Invest time and efforts, if needed take help in making a CV that truly reflects your skills, expertise and achievements. It should be able to capture the attention of both the smartness of the systems and eye of the employer3) Constant Learning & Development : There are abundance of platforms that help working professionals to upgrade their knowledge by learning and developing in their core domain or interested areas to increase their credibility as a professional. 2 Hours of Learning every week can make your more resilient. Short term courses and Certifications do help and keep you above others.4) Network is Power : Great Network is always half work done. Investing time in growing your network, reaching out to the right people can help you to find your dream job even faster. A good network also helps in exchange of great knowledge and ideas.5) Finding a Job is a Process : It is not a luck or a by chance thing. Finding a job is a process and it will have its ups and down but surely learning all the way. Thus, one has to believe in the process, learn from it, be persistent and hopeful.6)Having a Mentor : Sometimes all it takes is a right conversation, little guidance or a small advise to boost your confidence and help you during low times. Thus having a good mentor is always like having a cheat code in a tough game. I Would be privileged if I can be of any help to anyone in their careers and always welcome everyone to learn, unite and grow together.I would love to hear from others if there is anything else that can help our friends in finding a new job or in building a resilient career during these testing times.#JobSearch #CareerAdvice #ProfessionalNetworking #layoffs #learning #people

Micro-Manage is Micro-Damage to the Culture. Dynamic and Agile leader should never Micro-manage.Recent article in TOI suggests the same Not micro-managing your team can bring several advantages:1. Employee Empowerment: By avoiding micro-management, you allow your team members to take ownership of their work and make decisions. This promotes a sense of empowerment, boosts their confidence, and encourages creativity and innovation.2. Improved Productivity: When employees have autonomy and the freedom to work in their own style, they can utilize their skills and expertise more effectively. This often leads to increased productivity as they can focus on their work without unnecessary interruptions or rigid controls.3. Enhanced Morale and Engagement: Trusting your team to handle their tasks without constant supervision fosters a positive work environment. It shows that you value their abilities and trust them to deliver results. This can improve employee morale, job satisfaction, and overall engagement.4. Professional Growth: Micromanagement can stifle professional growth as it limits employees' opportunities to learn and develop new skills. Allowing individuals to take on challenges, make mistakes, and learn from them promotes continuous learning and personal growth within the team.5. Time Management: By refraining from excessive monitoring, you can allocate your time more effectively. Rather than focusing on minute details, you can concentrate on strategic planning, building relationships, and addressing larger organizational goals.6. Collaboration and Teamwork: A non-micromanaging approach encourages collaboration and teamwork. When employees have the freedom to communicate, share ideas, and contribute to the decision-making process, it strengthens the overall dynamics of the team and promotes a culture of collaboration.7. Retention and Recruitment: A supportive work environment with less micro-management tends to attract and retain talented employees. Professionals seek autonomy, trust, and opportunities for growth. By offering these qualities, you can build a strong team and reduce turnover.Remember, effective leadership involves providing guidance, setting clear expectations, and being available for support when needed, while still giving your team the autonomy they need to thrive.

Mind-blowing SQL Notes + ğŸ‘‡10 commonly asked SQL interview questions that you can help you to get into Job ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’»1. What is SQL?SQL (Structured Query Language) is a programming language used for managing and manipulating relational databases.2. What are the different types of SQL statements?SQL statements can be broadly classified into three categories: Data Definition Language (DDL), Data Manipulation Language (DML), and Data Control Language (DCL).3. What is the difference between SQL and NoSQL databases?SQL databases are structured and use a tabular format to store data, while NoSQL databases are non-relational and use various data models such as key-value, document, columnar, or graph.4. What is a primary key in SQL?A primary key is a column or combination of columns that uniquely identifies each row in a table. It ensures data integrity and enables efficient data retrieval.5. What is a foreign key?A foreign key is a column or set of columns in a table that refers to the primary key of another table. It establishes relationships between tables and enforces referential integrity.6. What is the difference between UNION and UNION ALL in SQL?UNION combines the result sets of two or more SELECT statements, removing duplicates, while UNION ALL combines the result sets without removing duplicates.7. What are SQL joins?Joins are used to combine rows from two or more tables based on related columns. Common types of joins include INNER JOIN, LEFT JOIN, RIGHT JOIN, and FULL JOIN.8. What is the difference between WHERE and HAVING clauses?The WHERE clause is used to filter rows before grouping in a query, while the HAVING clause is used to filter groups of rows after grouping in a query.9. What is normalization in SQL?Normalization is the process of organizing data in a database to eliminate redundancy and ensure data integrity. It involves dividing larger tables into smaller, more manageable tables and establishing relationships between them.10. How can you prevent SQL injection attacks?To prevent SQL injection attacks, it is important to use parameterized queries or prepared statements, properly validate and sanitize user input, and limit the privileges of database users.ğŸ“ğ—§ğ—˜ğ—Ÿğ—˜ğ—šğ—¥ğ—”ğ—   ğ…ğ¨ğ« ğ‰ğ¨ğ›, ğˆğ§ğ­ğğ«ğ§ğ¬ğ¡ğ¢ğ© ğğ¨ğ­ğğ¬ & ğˆğ§ğ­ğğ«ğ¯ğ¢ğğ° ğ”ğ©ğğšğ­ğğ¬ ğŸ“’  ğŸ“š :- https://lnkd.in/dUiGpNHyFollow R J Goswami  For More ğŸ”º#sql #sqldeveloper #sqlnotes

People confuse non-attachment with some renunciation & withdrawal from Life! The image conjured up is one where people head off to some caves donning saffron robes, chanting with beads in hand & ashes smeared on the forehead! It is anything but... Instead, it's a process where we come to terms with the Reality of Impermanence & seek to cling less tightly to everything! We try to figure out a path where we remain connected yet aware of the limitations of the system! When you no longer seek to find yourself in something, the detachment drops off in what seems natural as opposed to the struggle to let go!For me, this is better preparedness for the unexpected! When one is less set on a specific outcome, then you are in a much better place in handling whatever the outcome is! The ones who give up trying to control the uncontrollables have an edge as they are not fighting battles that cannot be won & can spend their time and energy on the movable parts! They have an Acceptance & a Surrender mindset and are able to handle and cope with Life's surprises! ğŸ—ï¸ By having less attachment, one is able to go with the flow! ğŸ—ï¸ It means that however things unravel, I will be OK! ğŸ—ï¸ My being OK is not attached to some specific outcomes beyond my control! Ask yourself, what am I so attached to that causes me on-going suffering & see if you can do the work to release it!!! If we do not learn how to connect the dots properly, we suffer from disconnect & that disconnect does not serve us... Saffron robes, bead collection & ashes - All optional ğŸ˜ğŸ˜ğŸ˜To be notified of my Daily Post - I invite you to "Ring my Bell" by clicking on the ğŸ”” icon!  #wisdomwednesday #whatinspiresme #energy #mindset #detachment

As the Menace of Layoffs is continuing and we are hearing about so many of our friends and peers loosing their jobs. I am of the opinion that more than the layoffs, it is untimely and unexpected ask by the organisation to leave when we are completely dependent on it without any backup or preparedness. Unfortunately in the last one week, I have received so many calls from the known and unknown sharing the bitter truth of them getting laid-off, looking for opportunities or an ideal to-do list to find a job. I am a firm believer that continuous efforts and constant learning in our careers will help us in the long term to become resilient.In the light of these developments, I would like to jot down few steps that have helped me and few of my other friends for a career transition or finding an ideal job or a new job search :1) Planning your career and Priorities well in advance : It is always important to have a long term plan of your career, understanding your top priorities in choosing a career and having a mental plan of how you look at your career for a decade or more will help in showing you way forward and taking the right next step in the direction2) CV That reflects and Speaks for you : CV is the first key to the door of opportunities. Invest time and efforts, if needed take help in making a CV that truly reflects your skills, expertise and achievements. It should be able to capture the attention of both the smartness of the systems and eye of the employer3) Constant Learning & Development : There are abundance of platforms that help working professionals to upgrade their knowledge by learning and developing in their core domain or interested areas to increase their credibility as a professional. 2 Hours of Learning every week can make your more resilient. Short term courses and Certifications do help and keep you above others.4) Network is Power : Great Network is always half work done. Investing time in growing your network, reaching out to the right people can help you to find your dream job even faster. A good network also helps in exchange of great knowledge and ideas.5) Finding a Job is a Process : It is not a luck or a by chance thing. Finding a job is a process and it will have its ups and down but surely learning all the way. Thus, one has to believe in the process, learn from it, be persistent and hopeful.6)Having a Mentor : Sometimes all it takes is a right conversation, little guidance or a small advise to boost your confidence and help you during low times. Thus having a good mentor is always like having a cheat code in a tough game. I Would be privileged if I can be of any help to anyone in their careers and always welcome everyone to learn, unite and grow together.I would love to hear from others if there is anything else that can help our friends in finding a new job or in building a resilient career during these testing times.#JobSearch #CareerAdvice #ProfessionalNetworking #layoffs #learning #people

Mind your Mind â€œDonâ€™t let others ruin your happinessâ€, one of my friends told me while referring to the constant politics at the office. Most of the times political correctness is important to succeed than mere performance. Thatâ€™s a fact. At times we take the office scene way too seriously. The only good thing is I have started to notice it more often than before. I canâ€™t stop the mind from thinking but what definitely I can control is the focus of my thinking ğŸ§ The epic text Bhagavad Gita explains à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤®à¤¨à¤¾ à¤­à¤µ à¤®à¤¦à¥à¤­â€à¤•à¥à¤¤à¥‹ à¤®à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤œà¥€ à¤®à¤¾à¤‚ à¤¨à¤®à¤¸à¥à¤•à¥à¤°à¥ à¥¤à¤®à¤¾à¤®à¥‡à¤µà¥ˆà¤·à¥à¤¯à¤¸à¤¿ à¤¯à¥à¤•à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥ˆà¤µà¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤‚ à¤®à¤¤à¥à¤ªà¤°à¤¾à¤¯à¤£: à¥¥ Engage your mind always in thinking of Me, become My devotee, offer obeisances to Me and worship Me. Being completely absorbed in Me, surely you will come to Me.(9.34)So the key is the â€˜engagement/focus of the mindâ€™. By shifting our focus we will able to free our mind and ourselves from the artificial shackles which is binding us. When you change your focus your goals and attachments automatically change. Hereâ€™s what can help us from coming out of that vicious circle â­•ï¸ 1. Mantra Meditation relaxes the mind like anything. Itâ€™s kind of reset the whole system. Do it for 10 mins to begin with everyday ğŸ§˜â€â™‚ï¸ 2. Make a list of 10 things which your profession canâ€™t provide you. You will be shocked to see the list has the most important things of our life. 3. Improve your engagement level at places other than office - home, social centre, gym, temple etc. Open up more avenues for your mind. 4. Last but not the least - READ BOOKS regularly. It stimulates the deep inherent power of the mind like anything. Donâ€™t stop thinking ğŸ¤” or try to become thoughtless you canâ€™t do that, just shift the focus of your thoughts. #corporatemythology #mindfulness #leadershipsutras

Indeed, pencil art can be incredibly beautiful.The fine lines, delicate shading, and intricate details created through pencil drawings can evoke a sense of elegance, realism, and artistic expression.Pencil art has a unique charm that captures the essence of the subject matter and showcases the skill and creativity of the artist.The monochromatic nature of pencil drawings allows for a focus on form, texture, and contrast, which can result in visually stunning artwork.Whether it's a portrait capturing the emotions and nuances of a person's face, a still life drawing with intricate details and textures of objects, or a landscape conveying a sense of depth and atmosphere, pencil art has the ability to captivate viewers and evoke an emotional response.Moreover, pencil art offers a timeless quality. Life after the layoff: DAY 52What was your shortest job tenure?For me, it was job number six.With the telemarketing chapter of my life complete, I was enjoying the life of a job-free high school senior. That was until my science teacher, Mr. Voigts, recommended me to Harlan, the owner of the local grain elevator at the north end of town. I went there and got the details from Harlan: work from after school until supper during the week, plus Saturdays. The wage was $7.25/hour, more than I earned in most other jobs before and after that for a while. I agreed, and started the next day.Farmers sell their corn and soybeans at a grain elevator at harvest time. You may have seen an elevator in a small town, with their shiny steel bins. Tractors pull up to them with their wagons and unload the grain â€“ this was where I helped out most of the time. The remaining time was just for odd jobs around the place, doing things that OSHA would probably frown upon, especially for a 17 year-old. Lots of finger-hungry machines and copious amounts of grain dust. The most harrowing thing was being asked to climb the metal ladder up the 70-foot-tall elevator leg to grease it. Still makes my palms sweat.The money was coming in and burning a hole in my pocket. I remember heading to Co-Op Records in the college town 45 minutes away to spend part of my first paycheck on a Pearl Jam live bootleg CD that cost $29.99. I was making bootleg-CD-level wages. Sweet!Harlan requested that I get the tractor from the shed and pull it around to hook up to another piece of equipment. This tractor had a loader on the front, making it stick out much more than I was used to. When I backed out, I turned too soon and peeled back about 18" of trim from the shed door. A silly mistake, but nothing that a hammer and three nails couldn't remedy.I received a somewhat stern warning to avoid hitting anything else on the property with the loader, especially the expensive blowers attached to the steel bins. I went about the rest of the shift feeling sheepish, but not concerned. At shift's end, I went inside to ask if I was needed the next day. This was normal, as it was always going to be a short-term gig during the peak of the harvest season. Every day so far, I was asked to return. Not this day."Do you need me to come in tomorrow, Harlan?" I asked."Nope, I think we're good," he said."How about the rest of the week?" I inquired, pretty much already knowing the answer."Nope."There you have it. Not dismissed, but not asked to return the next day, either. Those two and a half weeks of labor would be my last in the agricultural realm. I wasn't ready for content work yet, but I was one step closer.â¦ Let me know if you are looking for a UX/Content Design Leader, as I'm #opentowork! #layoffs #uxwriter #contentdesign #productdesign #UXdesign #contentstrategy â¦

People confuse non-attachment with some renunciation & withdrawal from Life! The image conjured up is one where people head off to some caves donning saffron robes, chanting with beads in hand & ashes smeared on the forehead! It is anything but... Instead, it's a process where we come to terms with the Reality of Impermanence & seek to cling less tightly to everything! We try to figure out a path where we remain connected yet aware of the limitations of the system! When you no longer seek to find yourself in something, the detachment drops off in what seems natural as opposed to the struggle to let go!For me, this is better preparedness for the unexpected! When one is less set on a specific outcome, then you are in a much better place in handling whatever the outcome is! The ones who give up trying to control the uncontrollables have an edge as they are not fighting battles that cannot be won & can spend their time and energy on the movable parts! They have an Acceptance & a Surrender mindset and are able to handle and cope with Life's surprises! ğŸ—ï¸ By having less attachment, one is able to go with the flow! ğŸ—ï¸ It means that however things unravel, I will be OK! ğŸ—ï¸ My being OK is not attached to some specific outcomes beyond my control! Ask yourself, what am I so attached to that causes me on-going suffering & see if you can do the work to release it!!! If we do not learn how to connect the dots properly, we suffer from disconnect & that disconnect does not serve us... #Employees #leaving a #job solely due to financial reasons is a common misconception. While #money is undoubtedly an important factor, it is not the sole determinant in an employee's decision to leave. Employees seek fulfillment, recognition, and a sense of belonging in their work environment. When employees feel #underappreciated and undervalued, it can have a significant impact on their job #satisfaction and overall #motivation.#Feeling #appreciated goes beyond monetary rewards. It involves recognizing employees' contributions, providing meaningful #feedback, and offering #opportunities for #growth and #development. When #employees feel that their efforts are acknowledged and their #skills are utilized effectively, they are more likely to remain engaged and committed to their work. On the other hand, when employees feel consistently overlooked or their achievements go unnoticed, they may start to question their worth within the organization and explore other options.#Creating a #positive work #culture that fosters appreciation and recognition can be instrumental in retaining talented employees. This involves fostering open #communication channels, providing regular feedback, and creating #opportunities for employees to showcase their skills and talents. Additionally, organizations should strive to align their values and goals with those of their #employees, #promoting a sense of purpose and fulfillment. By addressing these non-monetary factors and showing genuine #appreciation for their employees, #organizations can increase employee satisfaction, retention, and ultimately drive better performance.Follow - Dev Raj Saini Follow - Job Hunters United for jobs updates.#jobs #work #salary #employees #appreciation

I got a job. After 40 interviews and what has to be hundreds and hundreds of applications, it finally worked out.Here are 9 things I learned during my job search after my layoff:1. Ensure your resume is compatible w/ applicant tracking systems. I had no idea this was a thing until I worked specifically with a resume writer, but given the sheer volume of applicants, having a resume that is automatically parsable by internal systems makes a difference.2. Daily goals. Setting daily goals helped me maintain a balance and create a routine as I was applying. For me personally, these included applying to at least 5 jobs daily, not turning on the TV until after 5pm, and spending at least an hour a day reading or learning something new. This helped create structure during an unpredictable period.3. Apply daily and filter on the last 24 hrs. Given the market, some jobs I applied for had 300+ applicants. To combat this, on a day to day basis, filter your search to jobs posted in the last 24 hrs. By doing so, I was usually within the first few to apply for a job, which helped get my foot in the door. Baking this into your daily routine makes it a lot less overwhelming to apply for positions, as there are fewer postings you need to scroll through every day.4. Nationwide vs city filters for remote jobs. If you are open to remote work, have separate alerts for your overall country as well as your individual city. A lot of remote jobs donâ€™t show up in city specific listings.5. Flexible title searching. Position titles change across companies, so donâ€™t just limit it to a single title search. Have a job search going for the specific title you are aiming for, but also have an alert that filters a more generic title e.g. â€œProduct Managerâ€, with additional filtering on experience level. 6. Responses come in waves. There will be weeks where you won't hear anything, and a week will come up where you hear from multiple places all at once. Remain patient, and know that responses and interview requests will come in batches.7. Compensation. Ask for the compensation range during your first call. Interview processes are extremely lengthy and time consuming, make sure that at the end of the line if you were to receive an offer, it would match your expectations.8. Culture & fit. While weâ€™re the ones applying for a job, its important to make sure that the company is a good fit for us as well. We spend so much of our time at work, so it's important to ask and assess things such as work culture, team dynamic, and manager personality and philosophy.9. Take time to relax. This is the most important. It's ok to do nothing for a bit. It's ok to take time out of your day and do something that brings you joy. It's ok to not have everything you do on a day to day basis be related to finding a job or bettering yourself.Â Extended time away from work, no matter the circumstances, doesn't come around often - use it well.#jobsearch #layoffs #jobhunt #hiring #jobhelp

ğŸŒ Exciting Development Alert: Elon Musk Indicates "Significant Investment" by Tesla in India! ğŸš€ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³I'm thrilled to share some remarkable news emerging from Tesla's CEO Elon Musk's meeting with India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his state visit to the United States. Musk revealed that PM Modi has been actively encouraging Tesla to make a "significant investment" in India, and he anticipates an official announcement in the near future.The meeting follows previous reports that Musk would brief PM Modi on Tesla's plans to establish a manufacturing base in India. India holds immense potential for a sustainable energy future, with opportunities spanning solar power, stationary battery packs, and electric vehicles. Musk expressed his aspiration to bring SpaceX's Starlink satellite internet service to India as well.Musk acknowledged PM Modi's strong commitment to India, stating, "He really cares about India because he's pushing us to make significant investments in India, which is something we intend to do."He also expressed confidence in Tesla's future presence in India, affirming their commitment to enter the Indian market as soon as possible.In response to the meeting, India's foreign ministry spokesperson tweeted that PM Modi had invited Musk to explore investment opportunities in electric mobility and the rapidly expanding commercial space sector in India.India's progressive stance toward its space sector includes plans to allow collaboration between U.S. companies and Indian firms for investments, with the goal of significantly increasing their share of the global launch market in the coming decade. As the Menace of Layoffs is continuing and we are hearing about so many of our friends and peers loosing their jobs. I am of the opinion that more than the layoffs, it is untimely and unexpected ask by the organisation to leave when we are completely dependent on it without any backup or preparedness. Unfortunately in the last one week, I have received so many calls from the known and unknown sharing the bitter truth of them getting laid-off, looking for opportunities or an ideal to-do list to find a job. I am a firm believer that continuous efforts and constant learning in our careers will help us in the long term to become resilient.In the light of these developments, I would like to jot down few steps that have helped me and few of my other friends for a career transition or finding an ideal job or a new job search :1) Planning your career and Priorities well in advance : It is always important to have a long term plan of your career, understanding your top priorities in choosing a career and having a mental plan of how you look at your career for a decade or more will help in showing you way forward and taking the right next step in the direction2) CV That reflects and Speaks for you : CV is the first key to the door of opportunities. Invest time and efforts, if needed take help in making a CV that truly reflects your skills, expertise and achievements. It should be able to capture the attention of both the smartness of the systems and eye of the employer3) Constant Learning & Development : There are abundance of platforms that help working professionals to upgrade their knowledge by learning and developing in their core domain or interested areas to increase their credibility as a professional. 2 Hours of Learning every week can make your more resilient. Short term courses and Certifications do help and keep you above others.4) Network is Power : Great Network is always half work done. Investing time in growing your network, reaching out to the right people can help you to find your dream job even faster. A good network also helps in exchange of great knowledge and ideas.5) Finding a Job is a Process : It is not a luck or a by chance thing. Finding a job is a process and it will have its ups and down but surely learning all the way. Thus, one has to believe in the process, learn from it, be persistent and hopeful.6)Having a Mentor : Sometimes all it takes is a right conversation, little guidance or a small advise to boost your confidence and help you during low times. Thus having a good mentor is always like having a cheat code in a tough game. I Would be privileged if I can be of any help to anyone in their careers and always welcome everyone to learn, unite and grow together.I would love to hear from others if there is anything else that can help our friends in finding a new job or in building a resilient career during these testing times.#JobSearch #CareerAdvice #ProfessionalNetworking #layoffs #learning #people

Embrace constructive criticism and view setbacks as learning experiences that contribute to your growth.ğŸ§  Maintain a positive mindset and persevere: Cultivate a positive attitude, even when facing challenging situations. Back to back interviews.Not a single candidate was meeting the expectations of the jury. Everyone seemed underconfident and nervous. Those who were confident didn't have the skills and practical knowledge. We were heading towards the end of the hiring session.Then a guy entered, he was a fresher and seemed very confident from his body language.As the interview went on, he performed really well.Me : "How did you prepare yourself for the interview?"Candidate : "I used to do mock interviews with other candidates."I was very impressed with this habit of the candidate. Mock interview sessions really help the candidate to develop confidence and good answering skills.He was hired !Whenever you are preparing for an interview always try to practice the probable questions and participate in mock interviews. It will really help you to boost your confidence.#hiring #hr #help #interview #mock #hired #job #jobopportunity #freshershiring

Mind-blowing SQL Notes + ğŸ‘‡10 commonly asked SQL interview questions that you can help you to get into Job ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’»1. What is SQL?SQL (Structured Query Language) is a programming language used for managing and manipulating relational databases.2. What are the different types of SQL statements?SQL statements can be broadly classified into three categories: Data Definition Language (DDL), Data Manipulation Language (DML), and Data Control Language (DCL).3. What is the difference between SQL and NoSQL databases?SQL databases are structured and use a tabular format to store data, while NoSQL databases are non-relational and use various data models such as key-value, document, columnar, or graph.4. What is a primary key in SQL?A primary key is a column or combination of columns that uniquely identifies each row in a table. It ensures data integrity and enables efficient data retrieval.5. What is a foreign key?A foreign key is a column or set of columns in a table that refers to the primary key of another table. It establishes relationships between tables and enforces referential integrity.6. What is the difference between UNION and UNION ALL in SQL?UNION combines the result sets of two or more SELECT statements, removing duplicates, while UNION ALL combines the result sets without removing duplicates.7. What are SQL joins?Joins are used to combine rows from two or more tables based on related columns. Common types of joins include INNER JOIN, LEFT JOIN, RIGHT JOIN, and FULL JOIN.8. What is the difference between WHERE and HAVING clauses?The WHERE clause is used to filter rows before grouping in a query, while the HAVING clause is used to filter groups of rows after grouping in a query.9. What is normalization in SQL?Normalization is the process of organizing data in a database to eliminate redundancy and ensure data integrity. It involves dividing larger tables into smaller, more manageable tables and establishing relationships between them.10. How can you prevent SQL injection attacks?To prevent SQL injection attacks, it is important to use parameterized queries or prepared statements, properly validate and sanitize user input, and limit the privileges of database users.ğŸ“ğ—§ğ—˜ğ—Ÿğ—˜ğ—šğ—¥ğ—”ğ—   ğ…ğ¨ğ« ğ‰ğ¨ğ›, ğˆğ§ğ­ğğ«ğ§ğ¬ğ¡ğ¢ğ© ğğ¨ğ­ğğ¬ & ğˆğ§ğ­ğğ«ğ¯ğ¢ğğ° ğ”ğ©ğğšğ­ğğ¬ ğŸ“’  ğŸ“š :- https://lnkd.in/dUiGpNHyFollow R J Goswami  For More ğŸ”º#sql #sqldeveloper #sqlnotes

People confuse non-attachment with some renunciation & withdrawal from Life! The image conjured up is one where people head off to some caves donning saffron robes, chanting with beads in hand & ashes smeared on the forehead! It is anything but... Instead, it's a process where we come to terms with the Reality of Impermanence & seek to cling less tightly to everything! We try to figure out a path where we remain connected yet aware of the limitations of the system! When you no longer seek to find yourself in something, the detachment drops off in what seems natural as opposed to the struggle to let go!For me, this is better preparedness for the unexpected! When one is less set on a specific outcome, then you are in a much better place in handling whatever the outcome is! The ones who give up trying to control the uncontrollables have an edge as they are not fighting battles that cannot be won & can spend their time and energy on the movable parts! They have an Acceptance & a Surrender mindset and are able to handle and cope with Life's surprises! ğŸ—ï¸ By having less attachment, one is able to go with the flow! ğŸ—ï¸ It means that however things unravel, I will be OK! ğŸ—ï¸ My being OK is not attached to some specific outcomes beyond my control! Ask yourself, what am I so attached to that causes me on-going suffering & see if you can do the work to release it!!! If we do not learn how to connect the dots properly, we suffer from disconnect & that disconnect does not serve us... ğŸŒâœˆï¸ Embrace the Journey: Travel - A Gateway to Personal and Professional Growth! âœˆï¸ğŸŒGreetings, LinkedIn fam! Today, I want to celebrate the incredible power of travel and its profound impact on personal and professional growth. Whether you're a seasoned globetrotter or an aspiring adventurer, there's no denying that travel holds the key to unlocking a world of opportunities and experiences.1ï¸âƒ£ Broadened Horizons: When we step out of our comfort zones and immerse ourselves in different cultures, landscapes, and perspectives, we open our minds to a whole new world of possibilities. Travel introduces us to diverse ways of life, customs, and traditions, fostering empathy and understanding that transcend borders.2ï¸âƒ£ Adaptability and Resilience: From navigating unfamiliar streets to communicating in foreign languages, every journey presents unique challenges that require adaptability and resilience. Traveling forces us to think on our feet, problem-solve, and embrace unexpected situations with grace.3ï¸âƒ£ Networking and Collaboration: Travel offers a myriad of opportunities to connect with people from different backgrounds and industries. Whether it's striking up a conversation with fellow travelers at a hostel or attending international conferences and events, these interactions can lead to valuable connections and collaborations. Who knows? Your next career breakthrough or innovative partnership might just be a flight away!4ï¸âƒ£ Creativity and Inspiration: Exposing ourselves to new landscapes, architectures, art, and cultures can ignite our creativity and fuel our inspiration. The sights, sounds, and experiences we encounter during our travels can spark fresh ideas, enhance problem-solving skills, and provide a wellspring of inspiration for professional endeavors. So, pack your bags and let your imagination soar!5ï¸âƒ£ Self-Discovery and Personal Growth: Travel often takes us out of our comfort zones and allows us to discover hidden facets of ourselves. It challenges us to face fears, push boundaries, and embrace personal growth. Whether it's conquering a hiking trail, trying local delicacies, or simply navigating through unfamiliar territory, each adventure becomes an opportunity for self-discovery and self-confidence.As we slowly emerge from a challenging period in history, let's remember the transformative power of travel. Whether it's exploring your own backyard or embarking on a cross-continental expedition, let curiosity be your compass and embrace the lessons that travel has to offer.ğŸ—ºï¸ So, let's connect and share our travel stories, insights, and aspirations. Together, we can inspire and empower one another to embark on transformative journeys that shape not only our careers but also our lives.âœˆï¸ğŸŒ Let's seize the world, one adventure at a time! ğŸŒâœˆï¸Thank you Aakanksha Monga for inspiring me and the world. ğŸŒ»#TravelTales #PersonalGrowth #ProfessionalDevelopment #Networking #Inspiration #GlobalMindset

Life after the layoff: DAY 52What was your shortest job tenure?For me, it was job number six.With the telemarketing chapter of my life complete, I was enjoying the life of a job-free high school senior. That was until my science teacher, Mr. Voigts, recommended me to Harlan, the owner of the local grain elevator at the north end of town. I went there and got the details from Harlan: work from after school until supper during the week, plus Saturdays. The wage was $7.25/hour, more than I earned in most other jobs before and after that for a while. I agreed, and started the next day.Farmers sell their corn and soybeans at a grain elevator at harvest time. You may have seen an elevator in a small town, with their shiny steel bins. Tractors pull up to them with their wagons and unload the grain â€“ this was where I helped out most of the time. The remaining time was just for odd jobs around the place, doing things that OSHA would probably frown upon, especially for a 17 year-old. Lots of finger-hungry machines and copious amounts of grain dust. The most harrowing thing was being asked to climb the metal ladder up the 70-foot-tall elevator leg to grease it. Still makes my palms sweat.The money was coming in and burning a hole in my pocket. I remember heading to Co-Op Records in the college town 45 minutes away to spend part of my first paycheck on a Pearl Jam live bootleg CD that cost $29.99. I was making bootleg-CD-level wages. Sweet!Harlan requested that I get the tractor from the shed and pull it around to hook up to another piece of equipment. This tractor had a loader on the front, making it stick out much more than I was used to. When I backed out, I turned too soon and peeled back about 18" of trim from the shed door. A silly mistake, but nothing that a hammer and three nails couldn't remedy.I received a somewhat stern warning to avoid hitting anything else on the property with the loader, especially the expensive blowers attached to the steel bins. I went about the rest of the shift feeling sheepish, but not concerned. At shift's end, I went inside to ask if I was needed the next day. This was normal, as it was always going to be a short-term gig during the peak of the harvest season. Every day so far, I was asked to return. Not this day."Do you need me to come in tomorrow, Harlan?" I asked."Nope, I think we're good," he said."How about the rest of the week?" I inquired, pretty much already knowing the answer."Nope."There you have it. Not dismissed, but not asked to return the next day, either. Those two and a half weeks of labor would be my last in the agricultural realm. I wasn't ready for content work yet, but I was one step closer.â¦ Let me know if you are looking for a UX/Content Design Leader, as I'm #opentowork! #layoffs #uxwriter #contentdesign #productdesign #UXdesign #contentstrategy â¦

Back to back interviews.Not a single candidate was meeting the expectations of the jury. Everyone seemed underconfident and nervous. Those who were confident didn't have the skills and practical knowledge. We were heading towards the end of the hiring session.Then a guy entered, he was a fresher and seemed very confident from his body language.As the interview went on, he performed really well.Me : "How did you prepare yourself for the interview?"Candidate : "I used to do mock interviews with other candidates."I was very impressed with this habit of the candidate. Mock interview sessions really help the candidate to develop confidence and good answering skills.He was hired !Whenever you are preparing for an interview always try to practice the probable questions and participate in mock interviews. It will really help you to boost your confidence.#hiring #hr #help #interview #mock #hired #job #jobopportunity #freshershiring

Mind your Mind â€œDonâ€™t let others ruin your happinessâ€, one of my friends told me while referring to the constant politics at the office. Most of the times political correctness is important to succeed than mere performance. Thatâ€™s a fact. At times we take the office scene way too seriously. The value of earning a livelihood most of the times is overestimated. Probably, itâ€™s the attachment to our posts and positions which doesnâ€™t allow us to see ourselves out of the office setting.I too like many other professionals struggle with this challenge. The only good thing is I have started to notice it more often than before. I canâ€™t stop the mind from thinking but what definitely I can control is the focus of my thinking ğŸ§ The epic text Bhagavad Gita explains à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤®à¤¨à¤¾ à¤­à¤µ à¤®à¤¦à¥à¤­â€à¤•à¥à¤¤à¥‹ à¤®à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤œà¥€ à¤®à¤¾à¤‚ à¤¨à¤®à¤¸à¥à¤•à¥à¤°à¥ à¥¤à¤®à¤¾à¤®à¥‡à¤µà¥ˆà¤·à¥à¤¯à¤¸à¤¿ à¤¯à¥à¤•à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥ˆà¤µà¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤‚ à¤®à¤¤à¥à¤ªà¤°à¤¾à¤¯à¤£: à¥¥ Engage your mind always in thinking of Me, become My devotee, offer obeisances to Me and worship Me. Being completely absorbed in Me, surely you will come to Me.(9.34)So the key is the â€˜engagement/focus of the mindâ€™. By shifting our focus we will able to free our mind and ourselves from the artificial shackles which is binding us. When you change your focus your goals and attachments automatically change. Hereâ€™s what can help us from coming out of that vicious circle â­•ï¸ 1. Mantra Meditation relaxes the mind like anything. Itâ€™s kind of reset the whole system. Do it for 10 mins to begin with everyday ğŸ§˜â€â™‚ï¸ 2. Make a list of 10 things which your profession canâ€™t provide you. You will be shocked to see the list has the most important things of our life. 3. Improve your engagement level at places other than office - home, social centre, gym, temple etc. Open up more avenues for your mind. 4. Last but not the least - READ BOOKS regularly. It stimulates the deep inherent power of the mind like anything. Donâ€™t stop thinking ğŸ¤” or try to become thoughtless you canâ€™t do that, just shift the focus of your thoughts. #corporatemythology #mindfulness #leadershipsutras

HOW IMPORTANT IS PRESENCE OF MIND!Presence of mind is the ability to keep your mind sharp and calm during stressful situations. It means you donâ€™t get lost easily when facing an unusual situation, even if itâ€™s for the first time.Presence of mind is a lifesaver in multiple situations. It helps you to stay alert and utilize your sharp mind.Presence of mind is also a bridge between your feelings and intelligence. It connects both elements to create a perfect balance of energy that can be used to cope with any situation in life.The most important function of presence of mind is to create higher consciousness and recognition of your feelings and thoughts. The ability to separate whatâ€™s beneficial and harmful at the current moment is invaluable.There is an abundance of distractions that occur everyday and cause lack of presence of mind. You need to be mindful of what you do and how you approach one situation or another.Presence of mind essentially brings you to happiness. Thatâ€™s because happiness comes mostly from being present in the moment.Presence of mind an inseparable part of a conscious life. If you want to be aware of your surroundings and you want to know yourself better, you should highly consider practicing presence of mind.Checkout the video ğŸ‘‡ to findout how the digger operator's presence of mind saves the cow from drowning!Video Credit - This is from the #socialmedia and all credit goes to the owner of the video. My Off-Campus Amazon Interview Experience:I applied through a referral from a college senior, which undoubtedly expedited my application process.A few weeks after applying, I received a link to an online assessment test, which took place on the Hackerrank platform. The assessment consisted of two coding questions that were intricately linked to Amazon's day-to-day operations. I was able to tackle the problems using Breadth First Search and priority queues. After a brief period, I received a call informing me that I had successfully passed the online assessment round. Then the onsite rounds were scheduled, which were conducted virtually using Amazon's internal tools. Round-1: The initial round was a DSA (Data Structures and Algorithms) round. The interviewer began by asking me to introduce myself and shared insights about his team. We then delved into two problem-solving exercises, one involving trees and the other centred around graphs. I confidently presented my solutions and discussed the time and space complexities associated with each approach. Round-2: This round, too, was focused on DSA. I was presented with two problems, for which I provided a greedy solution for the first and a hashmap solution for the second. To ensure clarity, I conducted dry runs on the inputs provided by the interviewer. Once again, we discussed the time and space complexities of both solutions.Round-3: The subsequent round was the Hiring Manager interview. The interviewer reviewed my resume, seeking deeper insights into my background. We engaged in a productive conversation that explored various aspects of my experience. Furthermore, the interviewer presented me with a design question. I provided client-side and server-side solutions.Note: For SDE-1 positions, in most companies including Amazon, design questions are not asked. I communicated it to the HM and he acknowledged it in the interview round itself.Round-4: The final round was the Bar Raiser interview, where I faced two additional DSA problems. I confidently presented my solutions and explained the time and space complexities associated with each one. Towards the end of the interview, the interviewer delved into behavioural questions.Note: The sequence of the Bar Raiser and Hiring Manager rounds may vary in different cases.If you're eager to learn more about interview tips or want to discuss any aspects of my experience, feel free to reach out to me here on LinkedIn or on topmate.io. I have also shared valuable insights for interviews in my previous posts, do check them out :) #interview

Mind-blowing SQL Notes + ğŸ‘‡10 commonly asked SQL interview questions that you can help you to get into Job ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’»1. What is SQL?SQL (Structured Query Language) is a programming language used for managing and manipulating relational databases.2. What are the different types of SQL statements?SQL statements can be broadly classified into three categories: Data Definition Language (DDL), Data Manipulation Language (DML), and Data Control Language (DCL).3. What is the difference between SQL and NoSQL databases?SQL databases are structured and use a tabular format to store data, while NoSQL databases are non-relational and use various data models such as key-value, document, columnar, or graph.4. What is a primary key in SQL?A primary key is a column or combination of columns that uniquely identifies each row in a table. It ensures data integrity and enables efficient data retrieval.5. What is a foreign key?A foreign key is a column or set of columns in a table that refers to the primary key of another table. It establishes relationships between tables and enforces referential integrity.6. What is the difference between UNION and UNION ALL in SQL?UNION combines the result sets of two or more SELECT statements, removing duplicates, while UNION ALL combines the result sets without removing duplicates.7. What are SQL joins?Joins are used to combine rows from two or more tables based on related columns. Common types of joins include INNER JOIN, LEFT JOIN, RIGHT JOIN, and FULL JOIN.8. What is the difference between WHERE and HAVING clauses?The WHERE clause is used to filter rows before grouping in a query, while the HAVING clause is used to filter groups of rows after grouping in a query.9. What is normalization in SQL?Normalization is the process of organizing data in a database to eliminate redundancy and ensure data integrity. It involves dividing larger tables into smaller, more manageable tables and establishing relationships between them.10. How can you prevent SQL injection attacks?To prevent SQL injection attacks, it is important to use parameterized queries or prepared statements, properly validate and sanitize user input, and limit the privileges of database users.ğŸ“ğ—§ğ—˜ğ—Ÿğ—˜ğ—šğ—¥ğ—”ğ—   ğ…ğ¨ğ« ğ‰ğ¨ğ›, ğˆğ§ğ­ğğ«ğ§ğ¬ğ¡ğ¢ğ© ğğ¨ğ­ğğ¬ & ğˆğ§ğ­ğğ«ğ¯ğ¢ğğ° ğ”ğ©ğğšğ­ğğ¬ ğŸ“’  ğŸ“š :- https://lnkd.in/dUiGpNHyFollow R J Goswami  For More ğŸ”º#sql #sqldeveloper #sqlnotes

I got a job. After 40 interviews and what has to be hundreds and hundreds of applications, it finally worked out.Here are 9 things I learned during my job search after my layoff:1. Ensure your resume is compatible w/ applicant tracking systems. I had no idea this was a thing until I worked specifically with a resume writer, but given the sheer volume of applicants, having a resume that is automatically parsable by internal systems makes a difference.2. Daily goals. Setting daily goals helped me maintain a balance and create a routine as I was applying. For me personally, these included applying to at least 5 jobs daily, not turning on the TV until after 5pm, and spending at least an hour a day reading or learning something new. This helped create structure during an unpredictable period.3. Apply daily and filter on the last 24 hrs. Given the market, some jobs I applied for had 300+ applicants. To combat this, on a day to day basis, filter your search to jobs posted in the last 24 hrs. By doing so, I was usually within the first few to apply for a job, which helped get my foot in the door. Baking this into your daily routine makes it a lot less overwhelming to apply for positions, as there are fewer postings you need to scroll through every day.4. Nationwide vs city filters for remote jobs. If you are open to remote work, have separate alerts for your overall country as well as your individual city. A lot of remote jobs donâ€™t show up in city specific listings.5. Flexible title searching. Position titles change across companies, so donâ€™t just limit it to a single title search. Have a job search going for the specific title you are aiming for, but also have an alert that filters a more generic title e.g. â€œProduct Managerâ€, with additional filtering on experience level. 6. Responses come in waves. There will be weeks where you won't hear anything, and a week will come up where you hear from multiple places all at once. Remain patient, and know that responses and interview requests will come in batches.7. Compensation. Ask for the compensation range during your first call. Interview processes are extremely lengthy and time consuming, make sure that at the end of the line if you were to receive an offer, it would match your expectations.8. Culture & fit. While weâ€™re the ones applying for a job, its important to make sure that the company is a good fit for us as well. We spend so much of our time at work, so it's important to ask and assess things such as work culture, team dynamic, and manager personality and philosophy.9. Take time to relax. This is the most important. It's ok to do nothing for a bit. It's ok to take time out of your day and do something that brings you joy. It's ok to not have everything you do on a day to day basis be related to finding a job or bettering yourself.Â Extended time away from work, no matter the circumstances, doesn't come around often - use it well.#jobsearch #layoffs #jobhunt #hiring #jobhelp

An absence of compassion can corrupt the decency of a community, a state, a nation."â¡ï¸Most people don't usually take stand for others because they think ğŸ’¬ âœ”ï¸It's none of their businessâœ”ï¸ It's not going to benefit them in any way. âœ”ï¸ It might get them in trouble ( they don't want to share the blame, burden or take responsibility for others )âœ”ï¸Lack of empathy and critical thinking ( Empathy is a skill that has to be developed by making a conscious effort)â¡ï¸If not corrected, such kind of attitude will get us in trouble sooner or later in life because when we will be in need of assistance, we are less likely to receive help from others too. â¡ï¸There are five main principles of social justice that are paramount to understanding the concept: Namely, 1)Access to resources, 2) Equity, 3) Participation, 4) Diversity, and 5) Human rights.Write-Up: Jandeep Singh  #communalresponsibility #injustice #people

ğŸŒ Exciting Development Alert: Elon Musk Indicates "Significant Investment" by Tesla in India! ğŸš€ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³I'm thrilled to share some remarkable news emerging from Tesla's CEO Elon Musk's meeting with India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his state visit to the United States. Musk revealed that PM Modi has been actively encouraging Tesla to make a "significant investment" in India, and he anticipates an official announcement in the near future.The meeting follows previous reports that Musk would brief PM Modi on Tesla's plans to establish a manufacturing base in India. India holds immense potential for a sustainable energy future, with opportunities spanning solar power, stationary battery packs, and electric vehicles. Musk expressed his aspiration to bring SpaceX's Starlink satellite internet service to India as well.Musk acknowledged PM Modi's strong commitment to India, stating, "He really cares about India because he's pushing us to make significant investments in India, which is something we intend to do."He also expressed confidence in Tesla's future presence in India, affirming their commitment to enter the Indian market as soon as possible.In response to the meeting, India's foreign ministry spokesperson tweeted that PM Modi had invited Musk to explore investment opportunities in electric mobility and the rapidly expanding commercial space sector in India.India's progressive stance toward its space sector includes plans to allow collaboration between U.S. companies and Indian firms for investments, with the goal of significantly increasing their share of the global launch market in the coming decade. This presents an exciting opportunity for both Tesla and India's thriving space industry.Last month, Tesla executives engaged in productive discussions with Indian officials regarding the establishment of manufacturing facilities for cars and batteries in India. Musk shared that Tesla is expected to finalize a location for a new factory by the end of this year, highlighting India's appeal as a potential destination.With a growing emphasis on diversifying manufacturing bases and reducing reliance on China, U.S. companies are actively exploring opportunities in new markets. Tesla's interest in India aligns with this strategy, despite previous hurdles due to high import tax structures.This development comes amidst recent controversy surrounding Twitter, in which its co-founder accused India of threatening to shut down the platform for non-compliance with content takedown orders during protests.Musk, who owns Twitter, emphasized that platforms like Twitter must adhere to local government laws to avoid shutdowns, shedding light on the complexities of navigating global regulations.Stay tuned for further updates on Tesla's investment plans in India!Follow Herschelle Saldanha for more content on robotics and automation!#tesla #businessautomation #india #automation #robotics

ğŸ˜ To live a happy, meaningful, and purpose-driven life, it is important to have goals that provide direction, purpose, and a sense of fulfillment. ğŸ¯ Achieving goals in the corporate world necessitates strategic planning, effective execution, and continuous self-improvement. The following steps can guide you towards achieving your goals:ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» Clearly define your objectives: Articulate your aspirations for your corporate career and establish specific, measurable, attainable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART) goals that align with both your personal ambitions and the company's objectives.ğŸ“œ Develop a well-structured plan: Create a comprehensive plan that outlines the necessary steps to reach your goals. Break down your objectives into smaller, manageable tasks and set deadlines for each of them.ğŸ’¡ Enhance your skills: Continuously cultivate your skills and expand your knowledge in areas relevant to your goals. Stay updated on industry trends, enroll in training courses, participate in workshops, and seek guidance or mentorship from experienced professionals.ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ‘¦â€ğŸ‘¦ Build a robust network: Foster relationships with colleagues, mentors, and industry peers. Networking can offer valuable insights, opportunities, and support along your journey.ğŸƒâ€â™‚ï¸ Exhibit proactive behavior: Take initiative by volunteering for challenging projects, seeking additional responsibilities, and presenting innovative ideas. Demonstrating your willingness to go above and beyond can propel you towards success.ğŸ–Š Embrace feedback and learn from setbacks: Actively seek feedback from supervisors, colleagues, and mentors to identify areas for improvement. Embrace constructive criticism and view setbacks as learning experiences that contribute to your growth.ğŸ§  Maintain a positive mindset and persevere: Cultivate a positive attitude, even when facing challenging situations. Corporate life presents ups and downs, but maintaining perseverance and resilience is crucial for achieving long-term goals.ğŸ“Š Regularly evaluate and adapt: Continuously assess your progress towards your goals. Determine what is effective and what requires adjustments in your plan. Flexibility and adaptability are essential in the corporate world, so be open to refining your approach as you gain new insights.#success #growth #learning #networking #india #linkedin

People confuse non-attachment with some renunciation & withdrawal from Life! The image conjured up is one where people head off to some caves donning saffron robes, chanting with beads in hand & ashes smeared on the forehead! It is anything but... Instead, it's a process where we come to terms with the Reality of Impermanence & seek to cling less tightly to everything! We try to figure out a path where we remain connected yet aware of the limitations of the system! When you no longer seek to find yourself in something, the detachment drops off in what seems natural as opposed to the struggle to let go!For me, this is better preparedness for the unexpected! When one is less set on a specific outcome, then you are in a much better place in handling whatever the outcome is! The ones who give up trying to control the uncontrollables have an edge as they are not fighting battles that cannot be won & can spend their time and energy on the movable parts! They have an Acceptance & a Surrender mindset and are able to handle and cope with Life's surprises! ğŸ—ï¸ By having less attachment, one is able to go with the flow! ğŸ—ï¸ It means that however things unravel, I will be OK! ğŸ—ï¸ My being OK is not attached to some specific outcomes beyond my control! Ask yourself, what am I so attached to that causes me on-going suffering & see if you can do the work to release it!!! If we do not learn how to connect the dots properly, we suffer from disconnect & that disconnect does not serve us... Saffron robes, bead collection & ashes - All optional ğŸ˜ğŸ˜ğŸ˜To be notified of my Daily Post - I invite you to "Ring my Bell" by clicking on the ğŸ”” icon!  #wisdomwednesday #whatinspiresme #energy #mindset #detachment

Life after the layoff: DAY 52What was your shortest job tenure?For me, it was job number six.With the telemarketing chapter of my life complete, I was enjoying the life of a job-free high school senior. That was until my science teacher, Mr. Voigts, recommended me to Harlan, the owner of the local grain elevator at the north end of town. I went there and got the details from Harlan: work from after school until supper during the week, plus Saturdays. The wage was $7.25/hour, more than I earned in most other jobs before and after that for a while. I agreed, and started the next day.Farmers sell their corn and soybeans at a grain elevator at harvest time. You may have seen an elevator in a small town, with their shiny steel bins. Tractors pull up to them with their wagons and unload the grain â€“ this was where I helped out most of the time. The remaining time was just for odd jobs around the place, doing things that OSHA would probably frown upon, especially for a 17 year-old. Lots of finger-hungry machines and copious amounts of grain dust. The most harrowing thing was being asked to climb the metal ladder up the 70-foot-tall elevator leg to grease it. Still makes my palms sweat.The money was coming in and burning a hole in my pocket. I remember heading to Co-Op Records in the college town 45 minutes away to spend part of my first paycheck on a Pearl Jam live bootleg CD that cost $29.99. I was making bootleg-CD-level wages. Sweet!Harlan requested that I get the tractor from the shed and pull it around to hook up to another piece of equipment. This tractor had a loader on the front, making it stick out much more than I was used to. When I backed out, I turned too soon and peeled back about 18" of trim from the shed door. A silly mistake, but nothing that a hammer and three nails couldn't remedy.I received a somewhat stern warning to avoid hitting anything else on the property with the loader, especially the expensive blowers attached to the steel bins. I went about the rest of the shift feeling sheepish, but not concerned. At shift's end, I went inside to ask if I was needed the next day. This was normal, as it was always going to be a short-term gig during the peak of the harvest season. Every day so far, I was asked to return. Not this day."Do you need me to come in tomorrow, Harlan?" I asked."Nope, I think we're good," he said."How about the rest of the week?" I inquired, pretty much already knowing the answer."Nope."There you have it. Not dismissed, but not asked to return the next day, either. Those two and a half weeks of labor would be my last in the agricultural realm. I wasn't ready for content work yet, but I was one step closer.â¦ Let me know if you are looking for a UX/Content Design Leader, as I'm #opentowork! #layoffs #uxwriter #contentdesign #productdesign #UXdesign #contentstrategy â¦

Greetings Connections,I am excited to share that I have successfully completed my two-month internship at Cipla! This experience has been truly enriching, and I am grateful for the opportunity to work here.One of the things that I appreciated most about Cipla was the company culture. Cipla is truly committed to its motto of "Caring for Life," and this is evident in everything that the company does.
