Mind your Mind â€œDonâ€™t let others ruin your happinessâ€, one of my friends told me while referring to the constant politics at the office. Most of the times political correctness is important to succeed than mere performance. Thatâ€™s a fact. At times we take the office scene way too seriously. The value of earning a livelihood most of the times is overestimated. Probably, itâ€™s the attachment to our posts and positions which doesnâ€™t allow us to see ourselves out of the office setting.I too like many other professionals struggle with this challenge. The only good thing is I have started to notice it more often than before. I canâ€™t stop the mind from thinking but what definitely I can control is the focus of my thinking ğŸ§ The epic text Bhagavad Gita explains à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤®à¤¨à¤¾ à¤­à¤µ à¤®à¤¦à¥à¤­â€à¤•à¥à¤¤à¥‹ à¤®à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤œà¥€ à¤®à¤¾à¤‚ à¤¨à¤®à¤¸à¥à¤•à¥à¤°à¥ à¥¤à¤®à¤¾à¤®à¥‡à¤µà¥ˆà¤·à¥à¤¯à¤¸à¤¿ à¤¯à¥à¤•à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥ˆà¤µà¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤‚ à¤®à¤¤à¥à¤ªà¤°à¤¾à¤¯à¤£: à¥¥ Engage your mind always in thinking of Me, become My devotee, offer obeisances to Me and worship Me. Being completely absorbed in Me, surely you will come to Me.(9.34)So the key is the â€˜engagement/focus of the mindâ€™. By shifting our focus we will able to free our mind and ourselves from the artificial shackles which is binding us. When you change your focus your goals and attachments automatically change. Hereâ€™s what can help us from coming out of that vicious circle â­•ï¸ 1. Mantra Meditation relaxes the mind like anything. Itâ€™s kind of reset the whole system. Do it for 10 mins to begin with everyday ğŸ§˜â€â™‚ï¸ 2. Make a list of 10 things which your profession canâ€™t provide you. You will be shocked to see the list has the most important things of our life. 3. Improve your engagement level at places other than office - home, social centre, gym, temple etc. Open up more avenues for your mind. 4. Last but not the least - READ BOOKS regularly. It stimulates the deep inherent power of the mind like anything. Donâ€™t stop thinking ğŸ¤” or try to become thoughtless you canâ€™t do that, just shift the focus of your thoughts. #corporatemythology #mindfulness #leadershipsutras

Mind-blowing SQL Notes + ğŸ‘‡10 commonly asked SQL interview questions that you can help you to get into Job ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’»1. What is SQL?SQL (Structured Query Language) is a programming language used for managing and manipulating relational databases.2. What are the different types of SQL statements?SQL statements can be broadly classified into three categories: Data Definition Language (DDL), Data Manipulation Language (DML), and Data Control Language (DCL).3. What is the difference between SQL and NoSQL databases?SQL databases are structured and use a tabular format to store data, while NoSQL databases are non-relational and use various data models such as key-value, document, columnar, or graph.4. What is a primary key in SQL?A primary key is a column or combination of columns that uniquely identifies each row in a table. It ensures data integrity and enables efficient data retrieval.5. What is a foreign key?A foreign key is a column or set of columns in a table that refers to the primary key of another table. It establishes relationships between tables and enforces referential integrity.6. What is the difference between UNION and UNION ALL in SQL?UNION combines the result sets of two or more SELECT statements, removing duplicates, while UNION ALL combines the result sets without removing duplicates.7. What are SQL joins?Joins are used to combine rows from two or more tables based on related columns. Common types of joins include INNER JOIN, LEFT JOIN, RIGHT JOIN, and FULL JOIN.8. What is the difference between WHERE and HAVING clauses?The WHERE clause is used to filter rows before grouping in a query, while the HAVING clause is used to filter groups of rows after grouping in a query.9. What is normalization in SQL?Normalization is the process of organizing data in a database to eliminate redundancy and ensure data integrity. It involves dividing larger tables into smaller, more manageable tables and establishing relationships between them.10. How can you prevent SQL injection attacks?To prevent SQL injection attacks, it is important to use parameterized queries or prepared statements, properly validate and sanitize user input, and limit the privileges of database users.ğŸ“ğ—§ğ—˜ğ—Ÿğ—˜ğ—šğ—¥ğ—”ğ—   ğ…ğ¨ğ« ğ‰ğ¨ğ›, ğˆğ§ğ­ğğ«ğ§ğ¬ğ¡ğ¢ğ© ğğ¨ğ­ğğ¬ & ğˆğ§ğ­ğğ«ğ¯ğ¢ğğ° ğ”ğ©ğğšğ­ğğ¬ ğŸ“’  ğŸ“š :- https://lnkd.in/dUiGpNHyFollow R J Goswami  For More ğŸ”º#sql #sqldeveloper #sqlnotes

I got a job. After 40 interviews and what has to be hundreds and hundreds of applications, it finally worked out.Here are 9 things I learned during my job search after my layoff:1. Ensure your resume is compatible w/ applicant tracking systems. I had no idea this was a thing until I worked specifically with a resume writer, but given the sheer volume of applicants, having a resume that is automatically parsable by internal systems makes a difference.2. Daily goals. Setting daily goals helped me maintain a balance and create a routine as I was applying. For me personally, these included applying to at least 5 jobs daily, not turning on the TV until after 5pm, and spending at least an hour a day reading or learning something new. This helped create structure during an unpredictable period.3. Apply daily and filter on the last 24 hrs. Given the market, some jobs I applied for had 300+ applicants. To combat this, on a day to day basis, filter your search to jobs posted in the last 24 hrs. By doing so, I was usually within the first few to apply for a job, which helped get my foot in the door. Baking this into your daily routine makes it a lot less overwhelming to apply for positions, as there are fewer postings you need to scroll through every day.4. Nationwide vs city filters for remote jobs. If you are open to remote work, have separate alerts for your overall country as well as your individual city. A lot of remote jobs donâ€™t show up in city specific listings.5. Flexible title searching. Position titles change across companies, so donâ€™t just limit it to a single title search. Have a job search going for the specific title you are aiming for, but also have an alert that filters a more generic title e.g. â€œProduct Managerâ€, with additional filtering on experience level. 6. Responses come in waves. There will be weeks where you won't hear anything, and a week will come up where you hear from multiple places all at once. Remain patient, and know that responses and interview requests will come in batches.7. Compensation. Ask for the compensation range during your first call. Interview processes are extremely lengthy and time consuming, make sure that at the end of the line if you were to receive an offer, it would match your expectations.8. Culture & fit. While weâ€™re the ones applying for a job, its important to make sure that the company is a good fit for us as well. We spend so much of our time at work, so it's important to ask and assess things such as work culture, team dynamic, and manager personality and philosophy.9. Take time to relax. This is the most important. It's ok to do nothing for a bit. It's ok to take time out of your day and do something that brings you joy. It's ok to not have everything you do on a day to day basis be related to finding a job or bettering yourself.Â Extended time away from work, no matter the circumstances, doesn't come around often - use it well.#jobsearch #layoffs #jobhunt #hiring #jobhelp

ğŸŒ Exciting Development Alert: Elon Musk Indicates "Significant Investment" by Tesla in India! ğŸš€ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³I'm thrilled to share some remarkable news emerging from Tesla's CEO Elon Musk's meeting with India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his state visit to the United States. Musk revealed that PM Modi has been actively encouraging Tesla to make a "significant investment" in India, and he anticipates an official announcement in the near future.The meeting follows previous reports that Musk would brief PM Modi on Tesla's plans to establish a manufacturing base in India. India holds immense potential for a sustainable energy future, with opportunities spanning solar power, stationary battery packs, and electric vehicles. Musk expressed his aspiration to bring SpaceX's Starlink satellite internet service to India as well.Musk acknowledged PM Modi's strong commitment to India, stating, "He really cares about India because he's pushing us to make significant investments in India, which is something we intend to do."He also expressed confidence in Tesla's future presence in India, affirming their commitment to enter the Indian market as soon as possible.In response to the meeting, India's foreign ministry spokesperson tweeted that PM Modi had invited Musk to explore investment opportunities in electric mobility and the rapidly expanding commercial space sector in India.India's progressive stance toward its space sector includes plans to allow collaboration between U.S. companies and Indian firms for investments, with the goal of significantly increasing their share of the global launch market in the coming decade. This presents an exciting opportunity for both Tesla and India's thriving space industry.Last month, Tesla executives engaged in productive discussions with Indian officials regarding the establishment of manufacturing facilities for cars and batteries in India. Musk shared that Tesla is expected to finalize a location for a new factory by the end of this year, highlighting India's appeal as a potential destination.With a growing emphasis on diversifying manufacturing bases and reducing reliance on China, U.S. companies are actively exploring opportunities in new markets. Tesla's interest in India aligns with this strategy, despite previous hurdles due to high import tax structures.This development comes amidst recent controversy surrounding Twitter, in which its co-founder accused India of threatening to shut down the platform for non-compliance with content takedown orders during protests.Musk, who owns Twitter, emphasized that platforms like Twitter must adhere to local government laws to avoid shutdowns, shedding light on the complexities of navigating global regulations.Stay tuned for further updates on Tesla's investment plans in India!Follow Herschelle Saldanha for more content on robotics and automation!#tesla #businessautomation #india #automation #robotics

An absence of compassion can corrupt the decency of a community, a state, a nation."â¡ï¸Most people don't usually take stand for others because they think ğŸ’¬ âœ”ï¸It's none of their businessâœ”ï¸ It's not going to benefit them in any way. âœ”ï¸ It might get them in trouble ( they don't want to share the blame, burden or take responsibility for others )âœ”ï¸Lack of empathy and critical thinking ( Empathy is a skill that has to be developed by making a conscious effort)â¡ï¸If not corrected, such kind of attitude will get us in trouble sooner or later in life because when we will be in need of assistance, we are less likely to receive help from others too. â¡ï¸There are five main principles of social justice that are paramount to understanding the concept: Namely, 1)Access to resources, 2) Equity, 3) Participation, 4) Diversity, and 5) Human rights.Write-Up: Jandeep Singh  #communalresponsibility #injustice #people

People confuse non-attachment with some renunciation & withdrawal from Life! The image conjured up is one where people head off to some caves donning saffron robes, chanting with beads in hand & ashes smeared on the forehead! It is anything but... Instead, it's a process where we come to terms with the Reality of Impermanence & seek to cling less tightly to everything! We try to figure out a path where we remain connected yet aware of the limitations of the system! When you no longer seek to find yourself in something, the detachment drops off in what seems natural as opposed to the struggle to let go!For me, this is better preparedness for the unexpected! When one is less set on a specific outcome, then you are in a much better place in handling whatever the outcome is! The ones who give up trying to control the uncontrollables have an edge as they are not fighting battles that cannot be won & can spend their time and energy on the movable parts! They have an Acceptance & a Surrender mindset and are able to handle and cope with Life's surprises! ğŸ—ï¸ By having less attachment, one is able to go with the flow! ğŸ—ï¸ It means that however things unravel, I will be OK! ğŸ—ï¸ My being OK is not attached to some specific outcomes beyond my control! Ask yourself, what am I so attached to that causes me on-going suffering & see if you can do the work to release it!!! If we do not learn how to connect the dots properly, we suffer from disconnect & that disconnect does not serve us... Google new AI algorithm predicts heart disease from a simple eye scan.Goodbye to CT Scans, MRIs, Xrays. Presented by Google's CEO Sundar Pichai.Scientists from Google and its health-tech subsidiary Verily have discovered a new way to assess a personâ€™s risk of heart disease using machine learning. -By analyzing scans of the back of a patientâ€™s eye, the companyâ€™s software is able to accurately deduce data, including an individualâ€™s age, blood pressure, and whether or not they smoke. This can then be used to predict their risk of suffering a major cardiac event â€” such as a heart attack â€” with roughly the same accuracy as current leading methods.The algorithm potentially makes it quicker and easier for doctors to analyze a patientâ€™s cardiovascular risk, as it doesnâ€™t require a blood test.To train the algorithm, Google and Verilyâ€™s scientists used machine learning to analyze a medical dataset of nearly 300,000 patients. This information included eye scans as well as general medical data. As with all deep learning analysis, neural networks were then used to mine this information for patterns, learning to associate telltale signs in the eye scans with the metrics needed to predict cardiovascular risk#ai #data #machinelearning #deeplearning #neuralnetworks #learning #health #tech #event #software #google #medical #doctors #artificialintelligence #algorithms #algorithm #ml #iot

Life after the layoff: DAY 52What was your shortest job tenure?For me, it was job number six.With the telemarketing chapter of my life complete, I was enjoying the life of a job-free high school senior. That was until my science teacher, Mr. Voigts, recommended me to Harlan, the owner of the local grain elevator at the north end of town. I went there and got the details from Harlan: work from after school until supper during the week, plus Saturdays. The wage was $7.25/hour, more than I earned in most other jobs before and after that for a while. I agreed, and started the next day.Farmers sell their corn and soybeans at a grain elevator at harvest time. You may have seen an elevator in a small town, with their shiny steel bins. Tractors pull up to them with their wagons and unload the grain â€“ this was where I helped out most of the time. The remaining time was just for odd jobs around the place, doing things that OSHA would probably frown upon, especially for a 17 year-old. Lots of finger-hungry machines and copious amounts of grain dust. The most harrowing thing was being asked to climb the metal ladder up the 70-foot-tall elevator leg to grease it. Still makes my palms sweat.The money was coming in and burning a hole in my pocket. I remember heading to Co-Op Records in the college town 45 minutes away to spend part of my first paycheck on a Pearl Jam live bootleg CD that cost $29.99. I was making bootleg-CD-level wages. Sweet!Harlan requested that I get the tractor from the shed and pull it around to hook up to another piece of equipment. This tractor had a loader on the front, making it stick out much more than I was used to. When I backed out, I turned too soon and peeled back about 18" of trim from the shed door. A silly mistake, but nothing that a hammer and three nails couldn't remedy.I received a somewhat stern warning to avoid hitting anything else on the property with the loader, especially the expensive blowers attached to the steel bins. I went about the rest of the shift feeling sheepish, but not concerned. At shift's end, I went inside to ask if I was needed the next day. This was normal, as it was always going to be a short-term gig during the peak of the harvest season. Every day so far, I was asked to return. Not this day."Do you need me to come in tomorrow, Harlan?" I asked."Nope, I think we're good," he said."How about the rest of the week?" I inquired, pretty much already knowing the answer."Nope."There you have it. Not dismissed, but not asked to return the next day, either. Those two and a half weeks of labor would be my last in the agricultural realm. I wasn't ready for content work yet, but I was one step closer.â¦ Let me know if you are looking for a UX/Content Design Leader, as I'm #opentowork! #layoffs #uxwriter #contentdesign #productdesign #UXdesign #contentstrategy â¦

Mind your Mind â€œDonâ€™t let others ruin your happinessâ€, one of my friends told me while referring to the constant politics at the office. Most of the times political correctness is important to succeed than mere performance. Thatâ€™s a fact. At times we take the office scene way too seriously. The value of earning a livelihood most of the times is overestimated. Probably, itâ€™s the attachment to our posts and positions which doesnâ€™t allow us to see ourselves out of the office setting.I too like many other professionals struggle with this challenge. The only good thing is I have started to notice it more often than before. I canâ€™t stop the mind from thinking but what definitely I can control is the focus of my thinking ğŸ§ The epic text Bhagavad Gita explains à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤®à¤¨à¤¾ à¤­à¤µ à¤®à¤¦à¥à¤­â€à¤•à¥à¤¤à¥‹ à¤®à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤œà¥€ à¤®à¤¾à¤‚ à¤¨à¤®à¤¸à¥à¤•à¥à¤°à¥ à¥¤à¤®à¤¾à¤®à¥‡à¤µà¥ˆà¤·à¥à¤¯à¤¸à¤¿ à¤¯à¥à¤•à¥à¤¤à¥à¤µà¥ˆà¤µà¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤‚ à¤®à¤¤à¥à¤ªà¤°à¤¾à¤¯à¤£: à¥¥ Engage your mind always in thinking of Me, become My devotee, offer obeisances to Me and worship Me. Being completely absorbed in Me, surely you will come to Me.(9.34)So the key is the â€˜engagement/focus of the mindâ€™. By shifting our focus we will able to free our mind and ourselves from the artificial shackles which is binding us. When you change your focus your goals and attachments automatically change. Hereâ€™s what can help us from coming out of that vicious circle â­•ï¸ 1. Mantra Meditation relaxes the mind like anything. Itâ€™s kind of reset the whole system. Do it for 10 mins to begin with everyday ğŸ§˜â€â™‚ï¸ 2. Make a list of 10 things which your profession canâ€™t provide you. You will be shocked to see the list has the most important things of our life. 3. Improve your engagement level at places other than office - home, social centre, gym, temple etc. Open up more avenues for your mind. 4. Last but not the least - READ BOOKS regularly. It stimulates the deep inherent power of the mind like anything. Donâ€™t stop thinking ğŸ¤” or try to become thoughtless you canâ€™t do that, just shift the focus of your thoughts. #corporatemythology #mindfulness #leadershipsutras

HOW IMPORTANT IS PRESENCE OF MIND!Presence of mind is the ability to keep your mind sharp and calm during stressful situations. It means you donâ€™t get lost easily when facing an unusual situation, even if itâ€™s for the first time.Presence of mind is a lifesaver in multiple situations. It helps you to stay alert and utilize your sharp mind.Presence of mind is also a bridge between your feelings and intelligence. It connects both elements to create a perfect balance of energy that can be used to cope with any situation in life.The most important function of presence of mind is to create higher consciousness and recognition of your feelings and thoughts. The ability to separate whatâ€™s beneficial and harmful at the current moment is invaluable.There is an abundance of distractions that occur everyday and cause lack of presence of mind. You need to be mindful of what you do and how you approach one situation or another.Presence of mind essentially brings you to happiness. Thatâ€™s because happiness comes mostly from being present in the moment.Presence of mind an inseparable part of a conscious life. If you want to be aware of your surroundings and you want to know yourself better, you should highly consider practicing presence of mind.Checkout the video ğŸ‘‡ to findout how the digger operator's presence of mind saves the cow from drowning!Video Credit - This is from the #socialmedia and all credit goes to the owner of the video. I feel sympathy for the 22,500 employees of Credit Suisse who are about to lose their jobs https://lnkd.in/gS575ai9.  Some of them have no doubt lost a significant portion of their savings also, due to 401k plan investments, deferred compensation, etc.  At one time, Credit Suisse was a world-class firm, highly regarded by competitors and customers alike.  And in different ways, this will be a painful, awful experience for all CS former employees living through this transition, just as it was for the thousands of people (myself included) who lost their jobs when Bear Stearns hit the wall in 2008.  Nobody likes losing their job, but when a firm collapses in ignominious fashion, it is especially difficult.  As with the Bear collapse and the Lehman bankruptcy, reputations have been damaged.  But you are not your firm, and you are not your firm's incompetent management (unless you are, in fact, the management, in which case you should be ashamed of yourselves).   Wall Street is great at creative destruction, so if you work hard, remain modest, and focus on your customers, you will be able to rebuild your career.   #creditsuisse #ubs #layoffs #wallstreet #transitions

ğŸŒâœˆï¸ Embrace the Journey: Travel - A Gateway to Personal and Professional Growth! âœˆï¸ğŸŒGreetings, LinkedIn fam! Today, I want to celebrate the incredible power of travel and its profound impact on personal and professional growth. Whether you're a seasoned globetrotter or an aspiring adventurer, there's no denying that travel holds the key to unlocking a world of opportunities and experiences.1ï¸âƒ£ Broadened Horizons: When we step out of our comfort zones and immerse ourselves in different cultures, landscapes, and perspectives, we open our minds to a whole new world of possibilities. Travel introduces us to diverse ways of life, customs, and traditions, fostering empathy and understanding that transcend borders.2ï¸âƒ£ Adaptability and Resilience: From navigating unfamiliar streets to communicating in foreign languages, every journey presents unique challenges that require adaptability and resilience. Traveling forces us to think on our feet, problem-solve, and embrace unexpected situations with grace.3ï¸âƒ£ Networking and Collaboration: Travel offers a myriad of opportunities to connect with people from different backgrounds and industries. Whether it's striking up a conversation with fellow travelers at a hostel or attending international conferences and events, these interactions can lead to valuable connections and collaborations. Who knows? Your next career breakthrough or innovative partnership might just be a flight away!4ï¸âƒ£ Creativity and Inspiration: Exposing ourselves to new landscapes, architectures, art, and cultures can ignite our creativity and fuel our inspiration. The sights, sounds, and experiences we encounter during our travels can spark fresh ideas, enhance problem-solving skills, and provide a wellspring of inspiration for professional endeavors. So, pack your bags and let your imagination soar!5ï¸âƒ£ Self-Discovery and Personal Growth: Travel often takes us out of our comfort zones and allows us to discover hidden facets of ourselves. It challenges us to face fears, push boundaries, and embrace personal growth. Whether it's conquering a hiking trail, trying local delicacies, or simply navigating through unfamiliar territory, each adventure becomes an opportunity for self-discovery and self-confidence.As we slowly emerge from a challenging period in history, let's remember the transformative power of travel. Whether it's exploring your own backyard or embarking on a cross-continental expedition, let curiosity be your compass and embrace the lessons that travel has to offer.ğŸ—ºï¸ So, let's connect and share our travel stories, insights, and aspirations. Together, we can inspire and empower one another to embark on transformative journeys that shape not only our careers but also our lives.âœˆï¸ğŸŒ Let's seize the world, one adventure at a time! ğŸŒâœˆï¸Thank you Aakanksha Monga for inspiring me and the world. ğŸŒ»#TravelTales #PersonalGrowth #ProfessionalDevelopment #Networking #Inspiration #GlobalMindset

Hey all, guess it's my turn to post..You probably haven't seen a post from me in a long time (if ever), I mostly use LinkedIn as a tool to learn from my networks and other professionals in my space.Unfortunately, after over 3 years at Route, the entire enablement department has been cut.I wanted to take a few days to reflect on my time at Route before posting. Route was a company where I was constantly challenged and was constantly learning. It's somewhere I made lifelong friends and grew tremendously, both professionally and personally. I was caught off guard and disappointed by this news, but over all, I am very thankful for my time at Route.I also want to take a moment to thank Jessika Ward and David Rogers for being two of the best leaders I've ever worked with. I've learned so much from you both and will miss working together. It's a small world and I'm sure we'll cross paths again.With that being said, I am now open for work! While I started out my career as an AE, I've leveraged that expertise into a Sales Enablement and Operations focus. I have in-depth experience creating and managing onboarding programs, creating long term training programs, change management, sales processes, etc.I'm open to roles in Revenue Enablement and Operations, and hope you'll all keep me in mind for any new opportunities that come up.Thank you all for your support and thank you to all my friends at Route, it's time to find my next adventure!#layoffs #salesenablement #salesoperations #techlayoffs #layoffs2023

Google new AI algorithm predicts heart disease from a simple eye scan.Goodbye to CT Scans, MRIs, Xrays. Presented by Google's CEO Sundar Pichai.Scientists from Google and its health-tech subsidiary Verily have discovered a new way to assess a personâ€™s risk of heart disease using machine learning. -By analyzing scans of the back of a patientâ€™s eye, the companyâ€™s software is able to accurately deduce data, including an individualâ€™s age, blood pressure, and whether or not they smoke. This can then be used to predict their risk of suffering a major cardiac event â€” such as a heart attack â€” with roughly the same accuracy as current leading methods.The algorithm potentially makes it quicker and easier for doctors to analyze a patientâ€™s cardiovascular risk, as it doesnâ€™t require a blood test.To train the algorithm, Google and Verilyâ€™s scientists used machine learning to analyze a medical dataset of nearly 300,000 patients. This information included eye scans as well as general medical data. As with all deep learning analysis, neural networks were then used to mine this information for patterns, learning to associate telltale signs in the eye scans with the metrics needed to predict cardiovascular risk#ai #data #machinelearning #deeplearning #neuralnetworks #learning #health #tech #event #software #google #medical #doctors #artificialintelligence #algorithms #algorithm #ml #iot

Here it is â†’ğŸ”¹ Understand the basics: Learn about memoization, overlapping subproblems, and optimal substructure to grasp the core concepts behind Dynamic Programming.ğŸ”¹ Solve simple problems: Start solving straightforward problems using Dynamic Programming to gain familiarity with the approach and build confidence.ğŸ”¹ Study different problem types: Explore various types of Dynamic Programming problems, such as matrix-based, string-based, and sequence-based, to broaden your understanding and problem-solving skills.ğŸ”¹ Practice problem-solving techniques: Master common techniques like tabulation and recursion with memoization to implement Dynamic Programming solutions effectively.ğŸ”¹ Analyze complex problems: Challenge yourself with more complex problems, involving multiple variables or constraints, and practice optimizing time and space complexities using Dynamic Programming.Follow this structured roadmap, and results will follow.
